newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Malaysia OTCs overshadow Singapore shares at close.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia OTCs overshadow Singapore shares at close.

text.p: Malaysian shares traded over the counter stole the limelight in the Singapore share market on index fund buying and arbitraging, dealers said on Thursday.
"Some index funds from Japan are buying Malaysian blue chips," said an institutional dealer.
He said investors also took advantage of price differentials between Malaysian shares traded on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange and those traded over the counter here.
The Straits Times Industrials Index fell 12.13 points to 2,150.76 while the UOB-OTC index tracking mainly Malaysian OTCs was up 6.73 points to 1,185.76.

"Singapore has reached a stage where people just don't know what to buy. Funds already have their belly full of Singapore blue chips and whatever switching there is, it's already done," said a dealer from a foreign broking house.

Malaysia's Genting Bhd gained Singapore $0.60 (US$0.43) to S$11.20 and Hong Leong Credit rose up S$0.60 to S$7.40. Dairy Farm led the actives with 6.2 million shares and was up US$0.015 to $0.60. Sentiment on the stock was poor because of its poor earnings, dealers said.
